text: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has gained new powers to recover property tax arrears by attaching the bank accounts of defaulters. With around three lakh properties on the tax default list, BBMP issued a notification allowing them to serve attachment warrants to banks and take action under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita-2023 if banks fail to comply.
title: Property tax: BBMP can now order attachment of bank accounts of defaulters in Bengaluru
4 progs introduced with paid internship
Police identify 180 waterlogging spots, ask BBMP to fix them
Govt can’t deny maternity leave to contract staff: HC
Only 6 out of 208 engg colleges apply for BBA/BCA programmes

text: In Bengaluru, despite a 20% increase in flower production across the state, flower prices surged during the Shravana month and Varamahalakshmi Vratha. Jasmine prices quadrupled, reaching Rs 600-800 per kg. Crossandra and roses saw significant price hikes as well. Increased demand has outpaced supply, leading to higher costs, even with good rainfall boosting yields.
title: Festival high: Jasmine 300% dearer, kanakambara costs 3,000 per kg
Stuck for hours in school bus, kids send road-widening SOS
LTIMindtree gets ₹62 cr GST demand
Sarvam launches GenAI platform for India

text: Sanjay Lavakare shifted from a 16-year IT career to full-time painting. His latest artwork reflects Koramangala's unique elements, inspired by local resident discussions.
title: Engineer-turned-artist captures the essence of Koramangala in his art

text: With heavy rain benefiting farmers, the government decided to celebrate the Mysuru Dasara festival in a grand manner this year. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah confirmed the allocation of necessary funds. The nine-day festival starts on October 3 and concludes with the Jamboo Savari on October 12. Local artistes will have greater opportunities, and 18 elephants are shortlisted for the parade.
title: Grand Mysuru Dasara from Oct 3: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah

text: The Tungabhadra reservoir in Karnataka faced a crisis as a crest gate was washed away for the first time in 70 years. Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar announced an expert committee to evaluate all dams' structural safety in the state. Repairs are underway to save water and aid farmers, with JSW Steel engaged for production of a stronger gate.
title: After Tungabhadra dam scare, expert panel to assess safety of all reservoirs

text: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, moved up in opening trade on Wednesday. While BSE Sensex opened over 100 points up, Nifty50 was near 24,150.
title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex opens over 100 points up; Nifty50 near 24,150

text: Starbucks' shares jumped 25% with the hiring of Chipotle CEO Brian Niccol, enhancing its market capitalization by $21.4 billion. Analysts endorsed the appointment, crediting Niccol's successful tenure at Chipotle. They believe this move could mark a new chapter for Starbucks, potentially bringing significant improvements.
title: Starbucks gains $27 billion in a day on new ‘dream’ CEO

text: Levi Strauss & Co aimed to expand its business from $6.2 billion to $10 billion globally, with a significant focus on India. CEO Michelle Gass highlighted India's potential due to its large youth market. The company targeted better gender balance and a wider product range, especially in tops. India's segment for women increased from 20% to 30% of business revenue.
title: Levi's bets big on India as it chases $10 billion target

text: Kumar Mangalam Birla's children, Ananya and Aryaman, were inducted into Hindalco Industries' board. Both have previously joined boards of Grasim Industries and Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail. Ananya shifted focus from music to business, significantly impacting microfinance, while Aryaman oversees real estate and Aditya Birla Ventures, which invests in high-growth startups.
title: Kumar Birla's children join Hindalco's board

text: Global index provider MSCI lifted restrictions on Adani group stocks that were imposed after Hindenburg Research's report in January 2023. The move, despite a second Hindenburg report, led to some Adani stocks showing gains. The changes will be effective from the end of August during MSCI's current index review process.
title: MSCI lifts curbs on Adani group stocks

text: Maruti Suzuki India started exporting the first Made-in-India Fronx, an SUV, to Japan. Manufactured at the Hansalpur plant near Ahmedabad, the initial shipment of over 1,600 vehicles departed from Pipavav port. This marks a significant achievement as Japan is a highly quality-conscious automobile market, highlighting Maruti Suzuki's commitment to global safety and quality standards.
title: In a 1st, Maruti exports SUV to Japan from Gujarat

text: Cognizant's off-campus recruitment drive offering Rs 2.5 lakh per year has sparked debate, as it marks a new low in the Indian IT sector. Traditionally, IT firms offer new graduates annual salaries ranging from Rs 3.5 lakh to Rs 4 lakh. Concerns are raised over the industry's disregard for rising living costs in India.
title: Cognizant's RS 2.5 lakh annual pay, a decadal low, sparks outrage

text: On Tuesday, global market weakness and geopolitical tensions led to a strong selloff in Mumbai markets, with the Sensex dropping nearly 700 points and Nifty down by 208 points. Foreign funds aggressively sold off, leading to a net loss. Major sectors like banking and IT saw significant declines, although two companies had strong listings amid the broader market downturn.
title: Sensex slides nearly 700 points on global cues, profit-taking
Starbucks ousts CEO Laxman Narasimhan for Chipotle replacement

text: Stock market today: The primary driver of the losses was HDFC Bank, the most heavily weighted stock in the Nifty 50, which fell by 3.4%. While BSE Sensex ended the day at 78,956.03, down 693 points, Nifty50 closed the day at 24,139.00, down 208 points.
title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex ends 693 points down; Nifty50 above 24,100

text: Fixed deposit (FD) investors enjoyed high interest rates recently, but a decline might be imminent as the Reserve Bank of India considers future rate cuts. Banks have been slow to adjust deposit rates. Investors may look to lock in current high rates and consider long-term FDs.
title: FD interest rates set to fall? Why investing in long-term fixed deposits may make sense right now

text: The Central Board of Direct Taxes is reviewing foreign remittances over Rs 6 lakh for potential tax evasion, directing field formations to scrutinize Form 15CC data from the 2020-21 financial year.
title: Sent above a certain amount in outward foreign remittances? Here’s why you may be under I-T department scanner

Sundram Fasteners's chairman's daughter to trim holding co stake

text: Hindenburg Research's August 10 report revealed that Sebi chairman Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband had investments in offshore funds linked to Vinod Adani, brother of Gautam Adani. Offshore funds, often based in tax havens like the Cayman Islands and Bermuda, offer better returns and secrecy. Investments can be significant, with fees and tax implications varying by investor status.
title: Higher returns & secrecy draw rich to offshore funds

text: Bharti Global announced the acquisition of a 24.5% stake in BT Group plc from Altice UK, making it the largest shareholder. Bharti had already acquired 9.9% of BT. The move aligns with Bharti's strategy of investing in developed markets and enhancing India-UK business ties, subject to regulatory approvals and security clearance.
title: In role reversal, Bharti acquire 24.5% of iconic BT in $4 billion deal

text: On Monday, the Sensex dipped marginally by 57 points, closing at 79,649. This drop came as investors largely dismissed Hindenburg Research's report on a conflict of interest involving Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch in the Adani Group probe. Some Adani stocks fell, but not as severely as in early 2023. Despite foreign fund outflows, domestic funds remained aggressive buyers.
title: Sensex shrugs off Hindenburg charge, Adani stocks dip

text: In July, retail inflation in India fell to a near 5-year low of 3.5%, led by a drop in prices of vegetables, fruits, and spices. Industrial output growth also slowed to 4.2% in June. The easing inflation has sparked hopes for interest rate cuts in the second half of the fiscal year.
title: Retail inflation falls to near 5-year low of 3.5% in July
SpiceJet Mumbai airport dues: Flights won't be hit, says airline

text: July 2024 CPI inflation: According to MoSPI data, the provisional inflation rate stands at 3.54% for the entire country, with rural areas experiencing a higher rate of 4.10% compared to 2.98% in urban regions.
title: July CPI inflation sees sharp decline to 3.54%; lowest in nearly 5 years

text: The Tamil Nadu cabinet approved 15 industrial projects worth ₹44,125 crore, creating 24,700 jobs. Key investments include ₹21,340 crore by Sembcorp in Tuticorin and ₹2,600 crore by Motherson Group. The cabinet also sanctioned three renewable energy policies aimed at achieving 20,000MW by 2030 and approved a large housing complex for Foxconn employees.
title: Chennai: TN cabinet clears Rs 44,125 crore investment in key sectors, approves new energy policies

Channapatna bypoll could define future of DK Shivakumar and HD Kumaraswamy

text: Bangalore experienced a rainy week with light rain until Thursday and heavy rainfall on Friday and Saturday, according to the Indian Meteorological Department. The temperature on August 12, 2024, was recorded at 26.05 °C, with relative humidity at 82%. Rain and thundershowers were predicted for various districts, including Ramanagara, Chamarajanagar, and Bengaluru Urban.
title: Bangalore weather: IMD predicts week-long rain
3 dead, 5 injured as trucks collide on Bengaluru's Tumakuru road

text: A group of senior BJP members miffed with Karnataka BJP president BY Vijayendra planned a 188km 'Ballari Chalo' padayatra to highlight issues such as the Valmiki corporation scam and diversion of SCPTSP funds. Led by MLAs Basanagouda Patil Yatnal and Ramesh Jarkiholi, they aimed to brand the state government as anti-Dalit pending high command approval.
title: Miffed with state chief, Karnataka BJP bloc plans own padayatra

text: Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband, Dhaval Buch, refuted allegations from Hindenburg Research about their involvement in offshore entities linked to an Adani scandal. They emphasized their financial decisions were taken as private citizens and disclosed all required details to relevant authorities. SEBI addressed the allegations independently, while Buch criticized Hindenburg for not addressing regulatory concerns.
title: Full statement of Sebi chief, her husband on Hindenburg allegations
Hindenburg report: Government unlikely to wade into row, officials say report 'malicious'

text: Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) withdrew over Rs 13,400 crore from Indian equities in August, reversing prior investments. The outflow was driven by the unwinding of the yen carry trade and recession fears in the US. Elevated Indian stock valuations, geopolitical tensions, and weak US job data also contributed to this trend, according to analysts.
title: FPIs turn net sellers, withdraw Rs 13,400 crore
Amara Raja plans to set up battery plant in North India

text: Two industry bodies, Amfi and IVCA, voiced support for Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch and the markets regulator, dismissing Hindenburg's allegations as unwarranted and lacking context. They emphasized India's robust regulatory framework as a key factor in its economic progress and urged stakeholders to remain confident amid these claims, warning against hindering the nation's development.
title: Two industry bodies call allegations 'unwarranted'

text: In 2022, Madhabi Puri Buch became the first woman and first private sector professional to chair Sebi after a break. Known for her collaborative approach, IT focus, and data-driven decisions, she brought significant changes in market regulation. Before Sebi, she had a significant career at ICICI Bank and experience overseas with Greater Pacific Capital.
title: Tough-talking Madhabi Puri Buch broke several barriers

text: Dalal Street was not expected to react negatively to a Hindenburg Research report alleging conflicts of interest by Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch. Traders and fund managers expressed more annoyance at the U.S.-based short-seller. The impact of the report seemed minimal compared to global geopolitical and market volatility factors.
title: Hindenburg report not big negative for D-Street: Market players

text: The markets regulator Sebi dismissed allegations by Hindenburg Research about conflict of interest involving its chairperson, stating that adequate internal mechanisms were in place. Sebi emphasized its actions against Adani Group, highlighted completed investigations, and negated claims of regulatory changes favoring Blackstone. Sebi's response followed a show-cause notice issued to Hindenburg over illegal gains.
title: Sebi: Have mechanisms to fix conflict of interest issues

text: Government explored a new plan to blend 5% ethanol with diesel (ED-5) as it neared its target of 20% ethanol-blended petrol within two years. A meeting at the PMO was held to discuss this, with trials on older buses showing promising results. Further trials on heavy-duty vehicles are anticipated.
title: Government moves to ready ground for 5% ethanol mix in diesel

text: Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband, Dhaval, refuted allegations by Hindenburg regarding their investments linked to Adani stocks. They stressed the investments were made when they were private citizens and were fully disclosed. Sebi backed them, emphasizing adherence to regulations and market integrity. Adani dismissed Hindenburg's claims as manipulative.
title: Buchs, Sebi, Adani, fund deny Hindenburg allegations

text: Hindenburg Research responded to Madhabi Puri Buch and Dhaval Buch's release, which called their previous report character assassination. Hindenburg highlighted critical questions and admissions, including an email Buch sent in 2018 on behalf of her husband. They questioned Buch's investments through her husband while serving as a SEBI member and noted Buch's connection to a fund linked to Vinod Adani.
title: Madhabi’s response raises new critical questions: Hindenburg Research
Amara Raja breaks ground for customer qualification plant for EV cell manufacturing; eyes lead acid battery plant up north

text: Securities and exchange board of India (Sebi) responded to the Hindenburg report, asserting that chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch had made all required disclosures and recused herself in cases of conflict of interest. Sebi clarified the completion of 22 out of 24 investigations into the Adani Group and advised investors to exercise caution before reacting to such reports.
tags: Securities and exchange board of India
title: 'Madhabi Buch disclosed, recused herself when necessary': Sebi on Hindenburg report

text: The Adani Group denied the latest allegations made by the Hindenburg research. Hindenburg alleged that Sebi chairperson Madhabi Buch and her husband had stakes in offshore entities involved in the alleged Adani money siphoning scandal. The Adani Group called the claims malicious, emphasizing their transparency and regulatory compliance. Buch and her husband also refuted the allegations, offering complete transparency of their financial documents.
title: 'Malicious' and 'mischievous': Adani Group rejects allegations in new Hindenburg report

text: Reliance Industries Ltd planned to commission its first solar giga-factory in the current fiscal. The plant aimed to manufacture 20GW of solar PV by 2024-25 and expand to 100GW by 2030. Reliance focused on establishing manufacturing facilities, renewable energy projects, and self-sufficiency through local supply chains. Partnerships in the clean energy space were also pivotal.
title: Reliance to commission first solar giga-factory in FY25

text: Automobili Lamborghini saw record sales in India with 103 units sold in 2023, aiming to reach 150 units annually by 2026. India stands as the fastest-growing market for Lamborghini, ranked 14th globally and 6th in Asia Pacific. The firm's confidence stems from India's economic growth and young customer base.
title: Lamborghini bets big on India's long-term potential

text: India's coal imports rose by 5.7% to 75.26 million tonnes in the first quarter of the current fiscal compared to 71.16 million tonnes in the same period last fiscal, according to Mjunction data. Given surplus coal and reduced industrial activity during monsoon, import demand is expected to remain subdued in the coming months.
title: India's coal imports rise by 6 per cent to 75.26 MT in April-June

text: The combined market valuation of eight out of ten top firms fell by Rs 1,66,954.07 crore last week, with Reliance Industries and Life Insurance Corporation suffering the most. Alongside a 1.57% drop in BSE benchmark, major firms like State Bank of India, Infosys, and Tata Consultancy Services also saw significant declines in their market capitalizations.
title: Mcap of 8 of top-10 most valued firms erodes by Rs 1.66 lakh cr; Reliance, LIC biggest laggards

text: Madhabi Puri Buch, SEBI chairperson, and her husband, Dhaval Buch, denied allegations by Hindenburg Research regarding their involvement in offshore entities tied to the Adani Group scandal. The couple also expressed their disappointment and accused Hindenburg of resorting to character assassination in response to the regulatory measures. They emphasized that their life and finances are transparent and that they have consistently provided all necessary disclosures to SEBI over the years.
title: Sebi chief, husband reject Hindenburg allegations: 'Our life and finances are an open book'

text: Blazes have scorched more than 1.4 million acres, or nearly 2,200 square miles (5,700 square kilometers), Northwest Interagency Coordination Center spokesperson Carol Connolly said. That's more than any other year since 1992, when reliable records began to be kept, she said, and surpasses the previous record set in 2020.
title: Record-breaking wildfires scorch more than 1.4 million acres in Oregon, authorities say
Tamil Nadu: 5 students dead, 2 injured in car-lorry collision near Tiruttani

text: IT giants including TCS, Accenture, and Cognizant announced they would visit top engineering colleges in Chennai for campus recruitment in September. After a slow period, these visits signal a revival in hiring. Colleges have prepared students through various training programs, and companies like Google, Microsoft, and Apple have also shown interest, indicating a stronger placement season ahead.
title: IT majors return to campus, colleges hopeful of better placement season
A month on, police yet to trace stolen bike of IB officer

text: For nearly five years, officials from a Chennai panchayat misappropriated government funds meant for infrastructure, forging documents for non-existent projects and doubling bills. The 2006 audit exposed these discrepancies, leading to suspensions and legal action. The Chengalpet court sentenced the accused to one year in prison and a fine of ₹10,000 for each, with an additional month if unpaid.
title: Government funds misused by panchayat officials in Chennai for fake development projects
A weekend to remember: Sea of visitors at Guindy Children’s park
Ventilation woes in new MTC buses

text: Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin criticized the Right to Match rule ahead of the IPL 2025 auction, arguing it fails to provide players with their true market value. The BCCI discussed potential changes, including the reintroduction of RTM and extending the mega auction cycle to five years. Ashwin emphasized the rule's unfairness to players and other franchises.
title: Ashwin opposes reintroduction of this 'unfair' IPL auction rule

text: Alick Athanaze's crucial 92 helped the West Indies secure a draw against South Africa in a rain-affected first Test at Queen's Park Oval. Chasing a target of 298, Athanaze, along with Jason Holder, stabilized the innings. Keshav Maharaj was the standout bowler with match figures of eight for 164.
title: 1st Test: Athanaze heroics guide West Indies to South Africa draw

text: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik believes there is nothing to worry about Virat Kohli's form in the 2-0 ODI series loss to Sri Lanka, saying life wasn't easy for rest of the visitors' batters on pitches aiding spinners to a huge extent.
title: 'I'm not going to defend Virat Kohli, but...': Dinesh Karthik

text: Former India batter Wasim Jaffer and former England captain Michael Vaughan are known for their witty interactions on social media, often engaging in friendly banter on a range of topics.
title: Jaffer's savage reply after Vaughan teases him

text: The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) announced a 17-man squad for the upcoming Test series against Pakistan, with Shakib Al Hasan included despite the political turmoil in Bangladesh. The series, part of the ICC World Test Championship, runs from August 21st to September 3rd. Shakib, currently playing in Canada, will join the team in Pakistan. The squad also includes experienced players like Mushfiqur Rahim and Mominul Haque. Chief Selector Gazi Ashraf Hossain emphasized the importance of experience in the challenging tour ahead.
title: Bangladesh retain Shakib Al Hasan for Pakistan Test series

text: Legendary Australia cricketer Ricky Ponting said having cricket in the 2028 Olympic Games at the Los Angeles will just open up a completely different audience for the game.
title: 'Having cricket in Olympics opens up completely different audience'

text: Wasim Jaffer said that Arshdeep Singh could bring a left-arm pace option and the Indian Premier League (IPL) pace sensation Mayank Yadav, who set the league on fire with some fine bowling performances despite some injuries, could also be a "dark horse" contender to play the series if he is fit enough to play the series.
title: If Bumrah, Shami, Siraj stay fit...: Jaffer on India's chances in Australia

text: Suryakumar Yadav, India's T20 cricket team captain, visited Yankee Stadium in New York, where he was honored with a custom jersey by the New York Yankees. This visit followed his successful debut as T20 captain, leading India to a series victory against Sri Lanka. Suryakumar's presence highlights the bond between cricket and baseball, enhancing his international profile.
title: Watch: Suryakumar visits Yankee Stadium, receives special jersey

text: Kieron Pollard of Southern Brave smashed five consecutive sixes off Rashid Khan, turning the game and leading his team to victory over Trent Rockets in The Hundred. With 49 runs needed from 20 balls, Pollard's rapid 45 off 23 balls shifted momentum, helping Southern Brave chase down 127 and win with one ball to spare in Southampton.
title: Watch: Pollard smashes Rashid Khan for five consecutive sixes

text: South Africa led West Indies by 154 runs going into the final day of the first Test in Trinidad after rain again curtailed play on Saturday. Six hours, and two sessions, were lost to the wet weather with play only getting underway in the late afternoon, two hours from the close, but it proved enough time for South Africa to bowl the West Indies out for 233 in their first innings, a deficit of 124 runs after the visitors made 357. South Africa began their second innings in aggressive fashion and increased their lead as they were 30-0 at the close with Tony de Zorzi not out on 14 and Aiden Markram on nine.
title: 1st Test: Maharaj, Rabada put South Africa on top on Day 4

text: Former Indian coach and skipper Rahul Dravid opened up on his lowest point as Men in Blue's head coach, revealing it to be India's series loss to South Africa back in the 2021-22 season.
title: 'I would say...': Dravid on lowest point of his coaching career

text: The Bangladesh Cricket Board requested security assurances from the army for the women's T20 World Cup amid political instability following former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's resignation. Scheduled for October 3-20, the event's hosting in Sylhet and Mirpur may be relocated. BCB awaits the army's written assurance for security commitments before updating the ICC.
title: Women's T20 World Cup: Hosts BCB seek Bangladesh army's assurance

text: Ricky Ponting, after parting ways with Delhi Capitals, expressed his desire to continue coaching in the IPL. Ponting stated the team might be looking for an Indian coach to replace him. Despite a lack of awards during his tenure, Ponting remains eager for future opportunities while ruling out international coaching roles due to other commitments.
title: I'd love to coach again in the IPL: Ricky Ponting

text: A recent viral video showing Vinod Kambli struggling to walk raised concerns among fans. Close friends Ricky and Marcus Couto visited Kambli and found him in good spirits and better health than the video suggested. Kambli attributed his condition in the video to dizziness, not inebriation. The visit included reminiscing about cricket and family time.
title: I am fine and fit: Vinod Kambli tells his close friends

text: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma again fell short of a century but top scored as South Africa reached 344-8 at the close of play on the second day of the first Test against the West Indies at the Queen's Park Oval on Thursday. Bavuma scored 86 runs before falling leg before wicket to an away swinging full toss from Jayden Seales while opener Tony de Zorzi contributed 76. Wiaan Mulder (37) and Kagiso Rabada (12) were not out at stumps and will resume on Friday, with the hosts looking to wrap up the tail.
title: 1st Test: Bavuma top scores as South Africa reach 344/8

text: According to the ICC, Praveen Jayawickrama was approached to fix international matches during the 2021 season of the Lanka Premier League. Additionally, he was asked to approach another player to engage in match-fixing activities during the same tournament. Since June 2022, he has not represented Sri Lanka in any international matches.
title: ICC charges SL bowler Jayawickrama over match-fixing approach

text: The Sri Lankan cricket team has raised concerns about player safety ahead of their Test series against England starting August 21 at Old Trafford due to ongoing anti-immigrant riots in Britain. Some players, already in England for training, have requested enhanced security measures from Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC). The team manager, Mahinda Halangoda, has discussed these concerns with the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB), which has outlined a security plan including a dedicated liaison officer.
title: Sri Lanka raise security concerns over England test series amid UK riots

text: After India's series defeat by Sri Lanka, captain Rohit Sharma expressed concerns about the team's struggles against spin and the lack of sweep shots. Sri Lanka won the series 2-0, marking their first ODI series victory over India in 27 years. Rohit emphasized the importance of scoring during the powerplay and acknowledged Sri Lankan batsmen's smarter approach to handling spin.
title: Rohit Sharma explains why India failed to dominate SL spin

text: Wasim Jaffer expressed concern over India's limited ODI matches before the ICC Champions Trophy next year, following a series loss to Sri Lanka. India were defeated by 110 runs in the third ODI at R Premadasa Stadium, marking their first ODI series defeat to Sri Lanka in 27 years. India's next ODI series will be against England in February.
title: '3 ODIs before CT...': Jaffer 'concerned' about India's ODI schedule

text: Sri Lanka secured their first series win over India in 27 years with a 110-run victory in the third ODI at Colombo's R. Premadasa Stadium. The win was attributed to Sri Lanka's strategic advantage on home turf, exploiting spinning conditions to outplay India. The 2-0 series win was attributed to Sri Lankan spinner.
title: 'Indians usually play on good wickets and small boundaries'

text: LG VK Saxena directed the Archaeological Survey of India to restore the 17th-century Barapullah Bridge within three months, including proper lighting. The bridge, overrun by squatters, will be cleared and preserved. Saxena emphasized the maintenance of the bridge’s originality. Efforts align with his broader restoration initiatives across Delhi's historical monuments.
title: ASI to restore 400-year-old Delhi's Barapullah Bridge in 3 months

text: A 13-year-old boy, Aditya Mehto, died of electrocution while playing cricket in west Delhi. The incident occurred when he attempted to retrieve a ball and came into contact with a live wire. Aditya's father and local residents are protesting alleged negligence, citing poor maintenance of the ground's electrical wires. Authorities are investigating ownership and responsibility.
title: 13-year-old playing cricket electrocuted in Delhi's Ranhola

text: In the 2024 Paris Olympics, breaking made its debut, drawing significant attention. Japan's B-girl Ami won gold in the women's category, while Canada's B-Boy Phil Wizard clinched the men's gold. Although Indian breakers participated in qualifying events, they couldn't secure spots, partly due to inadequate support.
title: ‘Breaking’ news: Hip-hop Delhi tunes into new Olympic sport!

text: Due to heavy rainfall and flooding, schools in various cities of Rajasthan, including Jaipur and Bharatpur, are closed today, August 12, 2024. Meanwhile, in Kerala, schools in districts like Palakkad and Malappuram are likely to close today and in the coming days as the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued orange and yellow alerts. The situation is being closely monitored as the regions brace for continued adverse weather conditions.
title: Schools Closed in Several Rajasthan Cities Today Due to Torrential Rains; Kerala Districts Likely to Follow Amid Heavy Rain Alerts

text: The Ministry of Education will release the NIRF 2024 rankings today, August 12. The framework, approved in 2015, categorizes institutions into 13 groups. Last year, IIT Madras led in 'Overall,' while IISc Bengaluru topped the 'Universities' and 'Research' categories. The parameters for NIRF rankings include teaching, learning, resources, graduation outcomes, research, perception, outreach, and inclusivity.
title: NIRF Rankings 2024 to Be Announced Today: Check Top Colleges and Universities in India

text: To excel in applying to US colleges as an NRI student, focus on showcasing academic excellence, a standout personal statement, and strong extracurricular involvement. text: A recent study unveiled by NASA's InSight lander has found a massive reservoir of liquid water beneath Mars' surface, potentially capable of covering the planet in a global ocean. Seismic data suggest this water, located 7.2 to 12.4 miles deep, may indicate conditions favorable for microbial life. "Temperatures on present-day Mars become warm enough for stable liquid water near the top of mid-crust, and pores are expected to have closed at the bottom of the layer," the study said.

text: A researcher from the University of Edinburgh uncovered the earliest lunisolar calendar at Göbekli Tepe, an ancient site in Turkey. text: Cybersecurity researchers reported a significant rise in GPS spoofing incidents targeting commercial airliners, particularly near conflict zones. While not directly causing crashes, these incidents could lead to serious complications.

text: The Financial Services Commission of Mauritius responded to allegations by Hindenburg Research of using Mauritian shell companies and labeling the country a "tax haven." The FSC stated that Mauritius follows strict international practices, does not license the named funds, and emphasized compliance with OECD standards. The Adani Group and SEBI Chairperson Madhabi Buch denied any connection to the allegations. This statement comes in response to Hindenburg's allegations of complex offshore structures involving these funds and their connection to Vinod Adani and the current SEBI Chairperson, Madhabi Buch.

text: The Delhi High Court ordered a Noida resident to remove defamatory videos about Amul products from social media. This followed a viral claim of a centipede found in an Amul ice cream tub. text: A study linked the July 30 Wayanad landslides to heavy rainfall spurred by human-induced climate change. Over 140 mm of rain fell on already saturated soils in a single day, triggering massive landslides. Researchers suggested minimizing deforestation and quarrying while enhancing early warning and evacuation systems to mitigate future events.

text: Sachin Tendulkar showcased his left-handed batting skills in celebration of International Left-Handers Day. text: President Joe Biden Tuesday said he would attend Donald Trump's inauguration in January in case the Republican presidential candidate wins this year's election. "I have good manners, not like him," Biden told reporters after being asked if he'd attend. Trump did not attend Biden's inauguration in 2021. It was the first time in over 150 years that the outgoing president skipped the new president's swearing in.
title: Biden says he would attend Trump inauguration if he wins: 'I have good manners'

text: Israeli minister Itamar Ben Gvir's visit to Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound drew international criticism after he defied a ban on Jewish prayers at the site, prompting rebukes from the European Union, the US, France, and the United Nations. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken urged Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to prevent such "provocative actions" and focus on diplomatic efforts.

text: The Calcutta high court ordered the outgoing principal of RG Kar Medical College, Sandip Ghosh, to go on leave after he was quickly reassigned to Calcutta National Medical College. text: In the US presidential campaign, Trump and Harris surprisingly agreed that workers' tips should not be taxed. While their populist proposal gained traction among service-sector workers, it faced criticism for economic irresponsibility. Economists argued it could create inequities among workers. The specifics remain unclear, but potential costs could exceed $107 billion over a decade.
title: 'No tax on tips': Trump and Harris find common ground as a populist stance

text: On August 15, 1947, India attained freedom from British rule, and this day is celebrated annually as Independence Day. text: Levi Strauss & Co aimed to expand its business from $6.2 billion to $10 billion globally, with a significant focus on India. CEO Michelle Gass highlighted India's potential due to its large youth market. The company targeted better gender balance and a wider product range, especially in tops. India's segment for women increased from 20% to 30% of business revenue.

text: A senior resident doctor at SCB Medical College and Hospital in Cuttack was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting two women patients. text: Congress leaders, led by Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi, decided to stage nationwide protests on Aug 22, pushing for a JPC probe into the alleged Adani scam. text: The Delhi high court directed the Centre to clarify whether sodomy and non-consensual unnatural sex remain offences under the new Bharat Nav Nirmaan Samhita, which replaces the IPC. A PIL challenged the absence of legal provisions similar to IPC Sec 377, which punished non-consensual unnatural sex and related acts. The matter will be heard further on August 28.

text: Bangladesh police arrested former PM Sheikh Hasina's adviser Salman Fazlur Rahman and ex-law minister Anisul Huq after Hasina's ouster. They were detained for their alleged involvement in the deaths of a student and a street hawker during a clash with police. Rahman and his son have faced separate troubles involving employment and a bank loan default.

text: The BJP government in Madhya Pradesh mandated the incorporation of RSS-linked authors' books in college syllabi to acquaint students with 'Bharatiya Gyan Parampara'. Opposition Congress criticized the move, branding it as divisive. With over 30% of the 88 mandatory books being authored by RSS-linked individuals, the initiative aligns with the National Education Policy-2020.

text: The Election Commission discussed security arrangements for upcoming assembly polls in Jammu and Kashmir with the Union home secretary. Due to recent terrorist activity, over 16,000 security personnel will be necessary. Other considerations include climatic conditions, apple harvesting, and nomadic tribe migrations. The polls are expected to be scheduled after August 20.

text: A 68-year-old director of a private school in Bokaro, Jharkhand, immolated herself after arguments with NHAI officials who asked her to vacate the building for an expansion project. text: Gurmeet Ram Rahim, the head of Dera Sacha Sauda convicted in rape and murder cases, exited Rohtak’s Sunaria jail on a 21-day furlough. This marks his second release in 2024, amounting to 253 days of furlough since February 2022. His release came quickly following a court order and received clearances from Haryana and UP governments.

text: The Supreme Court ruled that the principle 'bail is the rule, jail is an exception' should also apply to cases under special statutes like UAPA, if conditions are met. The court granted bail to an ex-Bihar constable charged under UAPA, criticizing lower courts for not objectively analyzing evidence and focusing on the accused's alleged association with PFI.

text: An SUV ran over auto driver Ganesh Yadav, 36, while he was sleeping on Versova beach, leading to his death. His friend, Bablu Shrivastav, narrowly escaped with injuries. text: Protests erupted at medical colleges across India on Tuesday over the RG Kar Medical College case. text: Indian Railways decided against aluminum-bodied Vande Bharat trains with sleeper facilities due to high costs and lack of local expertise. text: Maharashtra deputy CM Ajit Pawar expressed regret over fielding his wife, Sunetra Pawar, against cousin Supriya Sule in Baramati during the LS polls. text: Former Bangladesh PM Hasina urged for justice, demanding punishment for those behind acts of terror and violence leading to deaths since July.
